info.name: AWS Marketplace Catalog API

request.description: [ListEntities](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/APIReference/API_ListEntities.html) API call enables you to get a list of entities of a given type with filters.

request.description: [DescribeEntity](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeEntity.html) API call returns the metadata and content of the entity.

response.name: DescribeEntity

request.description: This request will enable you to create a draft container product with a draft public offer. A public offer is public pricing available to a buyer on AWS Marketplace. A draft product and offer is not visible to buyers on AWS Marketplace until it is published.

This request will enable you to create a limited container product with a public offer. A public offer is public pricing available to a buyer on AWS Marketplace. A limited product and offer is visible to specific buyers (targeted with the product and offer) on AWS Marketplace.

This request will enable you to create a draft AMI product with a draft public offer. A public offer is public pricing available to a buyer on AWS Marketplace. A draft product and offer is not visible to buyers on AWS Marketplace until it is published.
This request will enable you to add support for a new region for an existing AMI product on AWS Marketplace.

Example of [UpdateFutureRegionSupport ](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/APIReference/work-with-single-ami-products.html#update-future-region-support) change type shows how to specify whether AMI assets are deployed in new regions built by AWS to support future regions.

[RestrctRegions](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/APIReference/work-with-single-ami-products.html#restrict-regions) change type enables you to restrict support for a region for an existing AMI product on AWS Marketplace.

[UpdateVisibility](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/APIReference/marketplace-catalog_example_marketplace-catalog_RestrictExistingAmi_section.html) change type enables the ability to restrict product visibility.

This request will enable you to create a limited AMI product with a public offer, with hourly pricing. A public offer is public pricing available to a buyer on AWS Marketplace. A limited product and offer is visible to specific buyers (targeted with the product and offer) on AWS Marketplace.

This request will enable you to create a limited AMI product with a public offer, with hourly monthly pricing. A public offer is public pricing available to a buyer on AWS Marketplace. A limited product and offer is visible to specific buyers (targeted with the product and offer) on AWS Marketplace.

This request will enable you to create a limited AMI product with a public offer, with hourly annual pricing. A public offer is public pricing available to a buyer on AWS Marketplace. A limited product and offer is visible to specific buyers (targeted with the product and offer) on AWS Marketplace.
AddDimensions and UpdatePricingTerms change types show how to add a dimension to an existing AMI product and update the offer pricing terms.

This request will enable you to create a limited SaaS product with a public offer with contract pricing. A public offer is public pricing available to a buyer on AWS Marketplace. A limited product and offer is visible to specific buyers (targeted with the product and offer) on AWS Marketplace.

This request will enable you to create a limited SaaS product with a public offer with contract (plus pay-as-you-go) pricing. A public offer is public pricing available to a buyer on AWS Marketplace. A limited product and offer is visible to specific buyers (targeted with the product and offer) on AWS Marketplace.

This request will enable you to create a limited SaaS product with a public offer with subscription pricing. A public offer is public pricing available to a buyer on AWS Marketplace. A limited product and offer is visible to specific buyers (targeted with the product and offer) on AWS Marketplace.

[UpdateVisibility](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/APIReference/marketplace-catalog_example_marketplace-catalog_RestrictExistingAmi_section.html) change type with TargetVisibility set to Public enables the ability to publish a SaaS product.
UpdateDimensions with key set to BasicService enables update to name dimensions on an AMI or SaaS product.

[DescribeProduct](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeEntity.html) API get request returns the metadata and content of the entity. In this case, with entityId set to PRODUCT_ID_SaaS in your environment variable, it will return the details of the SaaS product.
[DescribeChangeSet](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeChangeSet.html) API get request provides information about a given change set.

response.name: DescribeChangeSet

request.description:
[ListChangeSets](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/APIReference/API_ListChangeSets.html) returns the list of change sets owned by the account being used to make the call. You can filter this list by providing any combination of `entityId`, `ChangeSetName`, and status. If you provide more than one filter, the API operation applies a logical AND between the filters.

You can describe a change during the 60-day request history retention period for API calls.

[CancelChangeSet](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/APIReference/API_CancelChangeSet.html) API request is used to cancel an open change request. Must be sent before the status of the request changes to `APPLYING`, the final stage of completing your change request. You can describe a change during the 60-day request history retention period for API calls.
CreateResaleAuthorization change type enables you to create draft resale authorization for any product type so you can review them internally before publishing to a Channel Partner.

response.name: DraftResaleauthAllProductType

request.description: UpdateInformation change type enables you to update name and description of one-time or multi-use resale authorization before publishing for any product type.

response.name: UpdateUnpublishedResaleAuthorization

request.description: RestrictResaleAuthorization change type restricts resale authorization. A restricted resale authorization can no longer be used by a reseller to create a private offer. Existing private offers already created won't be impacted.

response.name: RestrictResaleAuthorization

request.description: This changeset publishes one-time resale authorization for any product type and add a specific buyer account for the resale.

response.name: PublishOnetimeResaleAuthSpecificBuyer

request.description: This changeset publishes one-time resale authorization for any product type and add Flexible payment schedule.
This changeset shows you how to publish multi-use resale authorization without an expiration date for any product type and add a specific buyer account for the resale.
This changeset  shows you how to publish multi-use resale authorization with an expiration date for any product type and add a specific buyer account for the resale.
This changeset shows you how to publish one-time resale authorization for any product type and add whether it is a renewal.
This changeset shows you how to publish a one-time resale authorization with a private offer so a Channel Partner can use it to create a Channel Partner Private Offer (CPPO).
This changeset shows you how to publish one-time resale authorization for any product type and add reseller contract documentation between the ISV and Channel Partner.
This changeset shows you how to publish one-time resale authorization for any product type and add a custom EULA to be sent to the buyer.
This changeset shows you how to publish multi-use resale authorization without an expiration date for an AMI product with hourly annual pricing so a CP can use that to create a CPPO.
This changeset shows how to publish multi-use resale authorization with an expiration date for an AMI product with hourly annual pricing so a Channel Partner can use it to create a CPPO.
This changeset shows you how to publish multi-use resale authorization without an expiration date for any product type and add reseller contract documentation between the ISV and Channel Partner.
This changeset shows you how to publish multi-use resale authorization without an expiration date for any product type and add a custom EULA to be sent to the buyer.
Provides the list of all resale authorizations in your account.

request.description: This changeset shows you how to publish multi-use resale authorization with an expiration date for an AMI product with hourly annual pricing so a Channel Partner can use it to create a CPPO.
This changeset shows you how to publish multi-use resale authorization with an expiration date for any product type and add a custom EULA to be sent to the buyer.
This changeset shows you how to publish multi-use resale authorization with an expiration date for any product type and add reseller contract documentation between the ISV and Channel Partner.

[DescribeOffer](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeEntity.html) API get request returns the metadata and content of the entity. In this case, with entityId set to OFFER_ID in your environment variable, it will return the details of an offer.

response.name: DescribeOffer

request.description: [ListEntities](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/APIReference/API_ListEntities.html) API call enables you to get a list of entities of a given type with filters. In this case, it will list offers in your account.

request.description: This changeset shows you how to create a draft private offer for an AMI or SaaS product so you can review it internally before publishing to buyers.
This changeset shows you how to update the refund policy of an offer.
This changeset shows you how to update an offer to apply hourly annual pricing.
This changeset shows you how to update an offer to apply a contract with Pay-As-You-Go pricing.
This changeset shows you how to update an offer to apply targeting to specific geographic regions.
This changeset shows you how to update name and description of a public offer.
This changeset shows you how to update the expiration date of a private offer to a date in the future to give buyers more time to evaluate and accept the offer.
This changeset shows you how to update the free trial duration of a public free trial offer for a SaaS product.
This changeset shows you how to create a replacement private offer from an existing agreement with contract pricing.
This changeset shows you how to create a public free trial offer with subscription pricing for a SaaS product.
This changeset shows you how to create a private offer with tiered contract pricing for a SaaS product.
This changeset shows you how to create a private offer with subscription pricing for a SaaS product.
This changeset shows you how to create a private offer with hourly pricing for an AMI product.
This changeset shows you how to create a private offer with hourly annual pricing for an AMI product.
This changeset shows you how to create a private offer with hourly annual pricing and a flexible payment schedule for an AMI product.
This changeset shows you how to create a private offer with contract and Pay-As-You-Go pricing for a SaaS product.
This changeset shows you how to create a private offer with contract pricing and a flexible payment schedule for a SaaS product.
This changeset shows you how to create a private offer with contract pricing for a Container product.
This changeset shows you how to create a private offer with contract pricing for an AMI product.
This changeset shows you how to create a draft CPPO for any product type so you can review them internally before publishing to buyers.
This changeset shows you how to update the expiration date of a CPPO to give buyers more time to evaluate and accept the offer.
This changeset shows you how to publish a draft CPPO and update price markup.
This changeset shows you how to publish a CPPO and append a buyer EULA.
This changeset shows you how to create a resale authorization replacement private offer with contract pricing from an existing agreement.
